title-group.article-title: The I That Tells Itself: A Bakhtinian Perspective on Narrative Identity

Bakhtin, M. M. Toward a Philosophy of the Act (written ca. 1919-1921; first published in the Soviet Union in 1986). Translated and notes by Vadim Liapunov, edited by Michael Holquist and Vadim Liapunov. Austin, Texas: Univ. of Texas Press, 1993.

---. "Author and Hero in Aesthetic Activity" (written ca.1922-1924; first published in the Soviet Union in 1977-1978); in Art and Answerability: Early Philosophical Essays by M.M. Bakhtin. Translated and notes by Vadim Liapunov, edited by Michael Holquist and Vadim Liapunov, Supple- ment translated by Kenneth Brostrom. Austin, Texas: Univ. of Texas Press, 1990.
---. Problems in Dostoevsky's Poetics (1929; 2nd edn. 1963). Translated and edited by Caryl Emer- son. Introduction by Wayne C. Booth. Minneapolis: Univ. of Minnesota Press, 1984.

---. "The Problem of the Text in Linguistics, Philology, and the Human Sciences" (1959-1961). In Speech Genres and other Late Essays. Translated by Vern W. McGee. Edited by Caryl Emerson and Michael Hoquist, 103-131. Austin: Texas Univ. Press, Slavonic Series, no. 8, 1986.
---. "Toward a Reworking of the Dostoevsky Book" (1961), in Problems of Dostoevsky's Poetics, Appendix II, 283-302.

---. The Ear of the Other: Otobiography, Transference, Translation. Translated by Avital Ronell. New York: Schoken Books, 1985.
